text:
Path.addJavaRuntime does not add a libgcj.jar file to the Path.
See attached patch for fix.
creator: green@redhat.com

text:
Created attachment 11570
Patch to solve problem.
creator: green@redhat.com

text:
I don't think using the whole bootclasspath would be the correct solution, is there
any way can detect the location of libgcj.jar based on other system properties
at run time?
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text: should work with CVS HEAD and Ant 1.6.2.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
